description: Edenham Way forms a key part of Goldfinger's Cheltenham Estate built between 1969 and 1973. The estate features five terraces of houses, two six-storey blocks of flats, four acres of open space and  the neighbouring Trellick Tower.

events.name: Visit Edenham Way
events.notes: Please ring the buzzer for number 80 on arrival. At busy times you may need to wait for a little while before there is space to come up to the flat.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The London Couny Council appointed Ernő Goldfinger to a list of approved architects for the council’s housing schemes in 1961, and commissioned him to design two housing estates – Edenham in Kensington, which became known as Cheltenham Estate, and Brownfield Estate in Poplar, east London, best known for the Grade II listed Balfron Tower, which Goldfinger drew on in his later design for Trellick Tower.

factsheet.heading: Edenham Way
paragraphs: Edenham Way shows off the skill of Goldfinger's team in outstanding use of concrete and planning of affordable council housing. While less famous than the neighbouring Trellick Tower it is a crucial part of the Cheltenham Estate and deserves to be better known and understood.

travel_info: Nearest tube: Ladbroke Grove, Westbourne Park

name: Edenham Way SOLD OUT
